channel.title: Hamachi?
channel.description: i know alot of you think hamachi is a joke witch it is but im helping my friend make a server he needs hamachi but when he clicks the on button it says a meditation server has rejected his request if anyone would help??? cuz i have no clue about hamachi maybe u do..

item.title: Hamachi?
item.dc:creator: @boomer4456 boomer4456
item.description:
@boomer4456 wrote:

[quote=“Cuban0 Ftw, post:4, topic:275093”]Try re-installing Hamachi; your error says you do not have the configuration data, I’m thinking that you accidentally deleted it.[/quote]what do u mean configeration data but ill try ill update you laters…[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 23, 2009, 04:43:31 pm[/size][hr]no cuban it didnt work…what now?

Read full topic

item.title: Hamachi?
item.dc:creator: @Cuban0_Ftw Cuban0 Ftw
item.description:
@Cuban0_Ftw wrote:

Try re-installing Hamachi; your error says you do not have the configuration data, I’m thinking that you accidentally deleted it.

Read full topic

item.title: Hamachi?
item.dc:creator: @boomer4456 boomer4456
item.description:
@boomer4456 wrote:

[quote=“Cuban0 Ftw, post:2, topic:275093”]Detail

This is fairly rare problem that would typically occur for one of three reasons.
A corruption of Identity information caused either by another piece of software on the machine or poking around the registry/config without care.
Installing and running 1.0 version, then downgrading to 0.9, and then upgrading back to 1.0. If you did in fact go through this sequence, please download and run this automated fixup utility http://files.hamachi.cc/hamachi-fixup.exe (~ 90KB)
Resolution

To work around corrupt profile
Shut down Hamachi completely
Go to Start > Run > %APPDATA%
Rename the Hamachi folder to HamachiBackup
Restart Hamachi
You will get a new Hamachi IP by doing this, however the existing was already corrupted by something on your machine.
To fix downgrade/upgrade/downgrade issue
Note, this is almost never the cause of this error. Unless you’ve actually run a Windows version of Hamachi older than 1.0, use the other two solutions first.
Download and save in temporary directory http://files.hamachi.cc/priv/hamachi-purge.reg (Right-click, Save As)
Run the file

Tell your friend to try that, if not tell me, I’ll be glad to help you fix it.[/quote]hmm ok… but my friend has already a hamachi ip…like 5.127 and such it just that it dosent conenct but well try[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 23, 2009, 04:23:12 pm[/size][hr]cuban help!!! i got this error message

Read full topic

item.title: Hamachi?
item.dc:creator: @Cuban0_Ftw Cuban0 Ftw
item.description:
@Cuban0_Ftw wrote:

Detail

This is fairly rare problem that would typically occur for one of three reasons.
A corruption of Identity information caused either by another piece of software on the machine or poking around the registry/config without care.
Installing and running 1.0 version, then downgrading to 0.9, and then upgrading back to 1.0. If you did in fact go through this sequence, please download and run this automated fixup utility http://files.hamachi.cc/hamachi-fixup.exe (~ 90KB)
Resolution

To work around corrupt profile
Shut down Hamachi completely
Go to Start > Run > %APPDATA%
Rename the Hamachi folder to HamachiBackup
Restart Hamachi
You will get a new Hamachi IP by doing this, however the existing was already corrupted by something on your machine.
To fix downgrade/upgrade/downgrade issue
Note, this is almost never the cause of this error. Unless you’ve actually run a Windows version of Hamachi older than 1.0, use the other two solutions first.
Download and save in temporary directory http://files.hamachi.cc/priv/hamachi-purge.reg (Right-click, Save As)
Run the file

Tell your friend to try that, if not tell me, I’ll be glad to help you fix it.

Read full topic
